node.title: Children from school south of Adelaide told to quarantine until Christmas after assembly named as exposure site
node.alt: A school building with the Australian and Indigenous flags flying on poles beside it
node.description: Children from aÂ school south of Adelaide will be in quarantine until 12:01am on Christmas Day, after the event was identified as a close contact exposure site.
node.content:
["Hundreds of children who attend a school south of Adelaide will be required to quarantine until 12:01am\u00a0on Christmas Day\u00a0after their end-of-year whole-school assembly was declared a COVID-19 exposure site.", "SA Health has declared the Willunga Primary School assembly, held on Friday between 9am and 10.30am, as a \"close contact\" exposure site.", "Under SA's contact tracing rules, unvaccinated people who attend such a site are required to immediately quarantine for 14 days from the date of exposure and get tested immediately, as well as on days 6 and\u00a013.", "Children under the age of 12 are not yet eligible to be vaccinated \u2013 meaning those who attended the assembly will be required to quarantine until 12:01am on Christmas morning.", "Vaccinated people who attended the event will be able to leave quarantine after seven\u00a0days.", "The listing of the school as an exposure site is also likely to have an impact on the parents of students.", "Those who did not attend the event and live with their child will escape quarantine, but must undergo COVID tests on days 1 and 6.", "Unvaccinated family members who share a home with the child must also quarantine for 14 days, unless they can be appropriately separated.", "As of term 3\u00a0this year, there were 432 students enrolled at Willunga Primary.", "The school year finished last Friday, however the school campus and associated Out of School Hours Care (OSHC) service will be closed tomorrow to allow for cleaning and contact tracing.", "In a letter to parents, the school's principal Melanie Jones said the service would reopen \"when public health officials indicate that we can\".", "\"When it reopens, anyone who has not been told to quarantine is able to return,\" she wrote.", "Earlier on Monday, SA authorities confirmed 13 new cases of COVID-19 in the state.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
